column4: is there a way of knowing *what* makes a filesystem busy when i try to unmount?
is it your current terminal where you're running the command ?
no.  i checked all my open terminals, and can't find it
n8tuser , managed to kill it.  for whatever reason kill in bash doesn't seem as powerful as it used to be.  more and more frequently i have to go the gui to kill a process properly
it probably ended up sending a different signal
the gui probably attempts 'friendly' signals, and gradually more 'ugly' signals to kill it
so, eh... what's the ugliest way of killing?
yes, but should not be abused. rarely needed.
and would i be right in assuming that the kill can then be graduated by -3 -4 ... -9 ?
no. 'man kill' lists the signals, and their respective numbers
though that 'kill' is not the actual one that bash uses. bash has its own builtin kill command
but the signal names are the same
